name: Triple Citrus Tuna Steak
author: thedailygourmet
summary: I'm a Floridian and we used to have a restaurant (now closed) near Madeira Beach. The tuna was incredible and this is my take on a special I once tried.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Prepare marinade: Whisk orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice, red onion, habanero pepper, vinegar, garlic, and oregano together in a bowl large enough to hold the tuna steaks
Prepare salsa: Combine mango, red onion, cilantro, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl
Prepare tuna: Sprinkle tuna with salt and pepper
Place in the bowl with the marinade and turn to coat
While tuna is marinating, crush potato chips as fine as possible in a blender
Remove tuna from the marinade and press into the crushed chips until both sides are well coated
Heat heavy-bottomed nonstick skillet over medium-high heat
Add butter and heat until butter melts and foam subsides
Add tuna and sear for 2 to 3 minutes on each side
To serve, top tuna with chile sauce and serve with jasmine rice and mango salsa
